mainText: Since it was set up in 2003, our 2-1-8 service has been hugely influencial in the development of more effective alternatives to custody for women in the justice system. Our latest video explains more about the service and how it works. Check it out on our YouTube channel.

Our new podcast Talking Point is available now. Episode 1 is about T.P.S. Connects. Craig Winter, Aileen Reid and Craig Mackenzie discuss the origins and development of T.P.S. connects, a community of people that have used Turning Point Scotlandâ€™s services. Search for Talking Point on your favourite podcast distributor.

T.P.S. Connects was created to give people a purpose and fulfilment beyond receiving support. Being part of something and meeting people can have a positive impact on health and well-being and it reduces loneliness and isolation. It provides a safe and welcoming environment, to help people feel involved, included, and to have their voice heard. Our new explainer video talks about the group and what it does. Find it on the Turning Point Scotland webpage and YouTube page.
